company_locations: Headquarters & Italian Factory – Northern Italy (between Milan and Bergamo)
Serbian Factory – near Novi Sad, northern Serbia

rules.why_relevant_summary: The chatbot and API-based agents are internal tools; anonymous/public users must not reach internal systems.
rules.compact_rule: IF user.is_authenticated == false THEN DENY all_access_to({CRM, ProjectRegistry, EmployeeRegistry, TimeTracking, InternalWiki, ChatbotActions}); // internal chatbot is for employees only

rules.why_relevant_summary: All access control relies on the mapped employee identity and system roles.
rules.compact_rule: FOR EACH session/chatbot_request: REQUIRE user.employee_id != null; BIND user.department, user.location, user.system_roles FROM EmployeeRegistry; ALL authorization_decisions MUST use this bound identity (NO privilege escalation or role spoofing by the agent).

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines which employee fields are world-visible inside the company vs confidential.
Salary and HR notes are highly confidential and must only be exposed to authorized roles.
Employee profile changes via chatbot (location, skills, wills, etc.) must respect role-based permissions.
CRM data is primarily owned by Sales & Customer Service; write access must be restricted accordingly.
Project registry is the system of record for projects and workload; only appropriate roles should modify core project fields.
Time entry lifecycle must be enforced; historic/approved entries cannot be silently altered by the agent.
Project leads may assist with draft time logging for team members but cannot finalize submissions for them.
The wiki must not become a store of sensitive personal data such as salaries.
rules.compact_rule:
IF target_system == Wiki AND content_to_write CONTAINS sensitive_personal_data({individual_salaries, confidential_HR_notes}) THEN
  DENY write_request; RETURN Outcome='denied_security'; // Enforce: 'Avoid storing sensitive information (e.g. individual salaries) in the wiki.'

rules.why_relevant_summary: System roles defined in core systems must be honored; the AI agent must not bypass or emulate higher-privilege roles.
rules.compact_rule:
ALL authorization MUST be derived from user.system_roles (e.g. 'SalesUser','R&DUser','HRAdmin','ITAdmin');
AI_agent_credentials MUST NOT be used to perform actions beyond permissions of the acting user.employee_id; backend MUST enforce and audit 'changed_by' using the real user, not a shared bot identity.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Outcome codes provide a standard way for clients to recognize security denials and unsupported operations.
Each core system is the single source of truth for its data type; agents must not create parallel/conflicting records elsewhere.
Skills & wills are maintained by employees and managers/HR and are used for staffing and development; unauthorized edits can distort planning.
The chatbot exposes cross-company search on people/skills, but must not leak confidential fields.
